name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-migrate-settings-approot
title: SPFx Legacy App Files Browser
shortDescription: A SharePoint Framework web part for browsing and viewing files in the legacy 'SharePoint Online Client Extensibility Web Application Principal' folder using native SPFx MSGraphClientV3.
longDescription: This sample demonstrates how to build a simplified interface for browsing and viewing files stored in the legacy 'SharePoint Online Client Extensibility Web Application Principal' folder using the native SPFx MSGraphClientV3. The web part provides a clean, professional interface for listing legacy app files and viewing their text content directly within the SharePoint page, making it easy to examine and migrate legacy SharePoint application data without custom authentication complexity.

references.name: Build your first SharePoint client-side web part
references.description: Client-side web parts are client-side components that run in the context of a SharePoint page. Client-side web parts can be deployed to SharePoint environments that support the SharePoint Framework. You can also use modern JavaScript web frameworks, tools, and libraries to build them.

references.name: Changes on SharePoint Framework (SPFx) permission grants in Microsoft Entra ID
references.description: Article explaining a set of changes to the way API permissions are managed in SharePoint Online by Tenant Administrators in SharePoint Framework (SPFx) starting from March 2025.
